newsitem.title: TURKEY: SOCCER-TRABZONSPOR COACH RESIGNS AFTER DEFEAT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-TRABZONSPOR COACH RESIGNS AFTER DEFEAT.

text.p: Senol Gunes, coach of the Turkish Black Sea soccer team Trabzonspor, resigned late on Saturday after a 3-0 away defeat by Istanbul club Besiktas.

Gunes offered his resignation after club chairman Mehmet Ali Yilmaz said after the match that there should be changes at the club. The club accepted his resignation at a hurried board meeting in an Istanbul hotel, Milliyet newspaper reported on Sunday.
Assistant coach Turgay Semercioglu will take over while the club looks for a replacement for Gunes.
Trabzonspor are now fourth in the Turkish first division but have failed to win any of their four games this season against Besiktas, Fenerbahce or Galatasaray, the teams ahead of them in the league.
Apart from these four teams, no side has won the Turkish title since the league was formed in 1959.
